When an earnest young man approaches to ask questions, Martin and Stephen Elliott capture Donald Rumsfeld 's disdain: Down there in the kid's eyes, Donald Rumsfeld sees broad leaves of intelligence but rooted in such soft soil that it might as well be sand. A zen garden. With a few green wisps that will blow flat at the first breath of wind. The world they live in is a blustery place. This is the son of a father who never went to war.
